intro: Shortia uniflora f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered shortia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range from white to pale pink. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky woods and streamside habitats. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is noted for its ornamental value and ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
